Headline: FOCUS: Reed Education Attractive To LBO Bids, But Timing Bad
Story: By Jessica Hodgson   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Reed Elsevier's (RUK, ENL) Harcourt Education unit, put on sale last Thursday, is an obvious target for private equity firms, analysts say, but some fear Reed hasn't chosen the best time to sell.   Reed said Thursday it would divest Harcourt, which it bought in 2000, following more than a year of underperformance due to contract losses and problems in its exam testing business.   But there are several other large publishing assets on the market. Thomson Corp (TOC) put its education unit up for sale last October, while Wolters Kluwer (39590.AE) announced a strategic review of its education unit last November, both citing the need for sustained investment to maintain a strong position in this market. And while there is scope for growth for the biggest and most technologically advanced market players, analysts think growth prospects are more limited for those who haven't yet embraced digital products.   Dresdner Kleinwort highlighted in a recent research note that London-based Pearson PLC (PSO), in particular, and to a lesser extent the McGraw Hill Cos. (MHL) have made much greater investment in technology-based education tools than other education publishers, and believes that increasingly those publishers without the resources or the inclination to put capital investiture into technology may exit the sector.   "(The growth of digital) leaves incumbent publishers with a stark choice: invest in technology and systems that power interaction between their content and their network, or exit the business now while valuations look attractive,"  Dresdner analysts say.    To some, Harcourt's recent performance suggests it may not be at the vanguard of the education publishing sector. In 2006, its underlying operating profit fell by 20%. Analysts this week estimated Harcourt will sell for between GBP1.6 billion and GBP2.0 billion, before tax and pension costs.   "Education businesses usually command a multiple of 10-12x earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization, which equates to GBP1.6 billion-GBP1.92 billion," Numis Securities said in a research note.   "However, given that there are other education businesses (notably Thomson College) for sale at the moment, we expect the proceeds to be at the lower end of this range; we expect private equity to be the buyer," Numis said.   Private equity firms, typically attracted to professional publishing businesses as their cashflow isn't tied to the advertising cycle, are expected to look at Harcourt. But many analysts said that because Thomson and Wolters Kluwer are also selling education publishing assets, Reed could get less for its assets than it would in other circumstances.   Reed Elsevier's chief executive, Crispin Davis, last week raised the possibility that a private equity bidder could combine Harcourt with Thomson's higher education unit, Thomson Learning, effectively reuniting two parts of a company that was split when Reed acquired Harcourt in 2001, and some analysts see this as a credible plan.   "It's possible a private-equity buyer would see a way of putting together Thomson's higher education business with Harcourt's school business," Davis said. "Certainly we will have (buying interest) from private equity. This is a favorable time to be selling this business."   Usman Ghazi, a media analyst at Dresdner Kleinwort, said he sees extensive sales, editorial and marketing synergies in recombining the split education business.   "There's definitely a play for private equity to combine Thomson Learning and Harcourt," he said.   Paul Gooden, a media analyst at ABN Amro, said a bidder could potentially use the combined assets to create a "mini-Pearson," focused on the education market, extract synergies and raise margins before re-floating the company.   Reed paid $4.45 billion for Harcourt and took on an additional $1.2 billion of debt, then immediately sold Harcourt's higher education business to Thomson for $2 billion.   The highly consolidated nature of the sector means existing trade players are unlikely to acquire Harcourt.   Dublin-based Riverdeep Group PLC, a "big four" U.S. publisher that recently completed a reverse takeover of Houghton Mifflin, is "interested," a person familiar with Riverdeep said. Riverdeep declined to comment.   Some analysts say Riverdeep, which paid about $1.75 billion and assumed about $1.61 billion in net debt for Houghton Mifflin, may face antitrust scrutiny, although its share of the market is lower than its larger rivals.   But the concentration of the market would likely bar Pearson and McGraw Hill from bidding, people familiar with those companies say. The two key education publishing markets in the U.S., where many of the big publishers make most of their revenue, are already highly consolidated.   In the schools sector, McGraw Hill, Pearson Group and Reed account for almost 75% of the market, while Houghton Mifflin has around 14%, according to 2005 market share figures from Dresdner Kleinwort. In higher education, Pearson, McGraw Hill and Thomson's combined market share is nearly 80%, Dresdner Kleinwort says.   A person familiar with Pearson, the largest player in the schools market, said a bid would almost certainly be blocked on antitrust grounds and thought it was likely the same criteria would apply to McGraw Hill. Neither Pearson nor McGraw Hill has said whether they would bid for Harcourt. The U.S. Federal Trade Commission couldn't immediately be contacted for comment Monday.   "We believe a trade buyer is unlikely to step in, with private equity the most likely acquirer," ABN Amro said in a research note.   Analysts forecast strong growth in the State Adoption cycle as individual U.S. states step up the commissioning  of new text books.   Some analyst point to the private equity industry's strong appetite for education assets, which they say could work in Reed's favor. Those that have showninterest in such assets in the recent past include Blackstone Group, Bain Capital, Thomas H. Lee & Partners, the former owner of Houghton Mifflin, Apax Partners, which has extensive U.K. media interests, Kohlberg, Kravis Roberts, which has recently made education-based acquisitions and was reported to be looking at Pearson, and Cinven Group Ltd., which has held many publishing investments. All of these companies either declined to comment or weren't available when contacted by Dow Jones Newswires.   Some analysts, however, are less convinced.   "The problem with selling the business is who is the ultimate buyer?" said Patrick Wellington, a media analyst at Morgan Stanley. "Unless someone comes fresh into the publishing business; I can see how private equity might buy it, but who would they sell it to?"   However, Dresdner Kleinwort's Ghazi said private equity companies moving into the college market may be able to find synergies in combining these with text book and software providers.   He cited the $3.1 billion buyout of Laureate Education, which owns a network of U.S. colleges, by an investor group including Kohlberg, Kravis Roberts and Citigroup Private Equity, a unit of Citigroup, in January. In March 2006, the private equity arm of Goldman Sachs Group (GS), along with Providence Equity, bought a similar college company, Education Management, for $3.4 billion.     -By Jessica Hodgson, Dow Jones Newswires; +44 207 842 92 93; jessica.hodgson@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 09:17 ET (14:17 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: 2nd UPDATE: Metrovacesa Top Holders Agree To Divide Company
Story: (This updates an article published at 0917 GMT to add background and analyst comments.)     By Santiago Perez   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     MADRID (Dow Jones)--Real estate company Metrovacesa SA (MVC.MC) Monday said its top shareholders - Chairman Joaquin Rivero, the Soler and the Sanahuja families - have agreed to divide the company in two, to end a board dispute for control of the firm.   Metrovacesa, the euro-zone's largest real-estate company by assets, will be divided into two separate entities - bringing to an end a high-profile bidding war for company stakes launched by two rival shareholder groups last year.   "The bidding process for Metrovacesa shares, conducted during 2006, resulted in discrepancies at the board, stemming from different views over the development model," Metrovacesa said in a filing with regulators.   The planned separation, the first of its size and kind for a listed company in Spain, takes place as the country's red-hot housing market is beginning to cool down after a decade of steady increases in house prices and vast mortgage lending.   One of the entities, to be called Metrovacesa, will comprise the company's Spanish real-estate assets as well as its French rental assets, and will be have the Sanahuja family as its main shareholder. The Sanahujas, who control Barcelona-based real-estate company Sacresa, currently own about 39% of Metrovacesa.   The second entity, to be called Gecina, will include the company's French real-estate assets and some of its Spanish office rental business. The rival group, led by Rivero and the Solers, will be its main shareholder.   Metrovacesa directors Bautista Soler Crespo and Maria Victoria Soler Lujan are also the leading shareholders of Valencia CF, one of Spain's top soccer clubs. The Rivero-led group currently owns about one-third of Metrovacesa.   "This goes in the opposite direction of Spain's corporate history, which has been more about mergers," said Inverseguros analyst Alberto Roldan, who has a sell rating on Metrovacesa.   The deal would also mark the departure of Rivero after he took control of the company in 2002. He was the main driver behind the positioning of Metrovacesa as a real-estate power house through an aggressive growth strategy.   Rivero's new focus on French real-estate and office rentals in Spain also takes place at a time of dramatic consolidation in Spanish real-estate listed companies through intense M&A activity ahead of an expected slowdown.    Metrovacesa, which acquired control of France's Gecina (1004086.FR) in 2005 in a deal valued at more than EUR5 billion, has a market capitalization of EUR12.6 billion and 107 million shares outstanding.   Spain's stock market supervisors Monday suspended trading in Metrovacesa shares ahead of the announcement. The trade halt "won't be lifted until the company submits sufficient information," the regulator said in a statement Monday. Metrovacesa said more information on the proposed separation will be disclosed later Monday.   It said minority shareholders will be given mechanisms to choose between the two projects. The proposed transaction still requires regulatory clearance.   Metrovacesa's shares closed Friday at EUR117.85.   With a thin free-float of about 14%, Metrovacesa share prices had staged a volatile ride in the past 12 months, doubling their value in just one year.   The free-float of Metrovacesa was squeezed by competing tender offers for company stakes as the dispute for control of Metrovacesa's board escalated last year. With the support of some smaller shareholders, the Rivero-led group maintained control of the company in its clash with the Sanahujas.   "We believe that the legal requirements for the operation will be long and complicated," said local brokerage Banesto, which has a sell rating on Metrovacesa shares and a price target of EUR65.14.   "From a stock price perspective, we believe that once the war between the top two shareholders concludes, Metrovacesa share prices should correct and adjust to the real value of their assets," wrote Banesto analyst Marta Gomez, who estimates the company's net asset value to be of about EUR51.2 per share.   Metrovacesa net profit for the first nine months of 2006  almost tripled to EUR861 million, on strong rental income and higher home sales in Spain.   After Metrovacesa took control of Gecina, the company has raised profit targets several times. Metrovacesa's management expects net profit to inch closer to EUR1.1 billion for the whole 2006.     Company Web site: http://www.metrovacesa.es     -By Santiago Perez, Dow Jones Newswires; 34-91-395 8119; santiago.perez@dowjones.com   (Jonathan House and Christopher Bjork contributed to this article.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 06:21 ET (11:21 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: PSivida Announces A$11.5M Private Placement >PSDV
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   pSivida Ltd. (PSDV) of Perth will make a private placement of 50 million fully paid ordinary shares at 23 Australian cents each for proceeds of A$11.5 million.   The pharmaceutical company said each share will be issued with two free attaching options at an exercise price of 23 Autralian cents for a term of four years.   The capital raising was undertaken in replacement of the previously announced Nordic Biotech Fund interim financing.   -Tara Zachariah; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 11:10 ET (16:10 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: TECHNICALLY SPEAKING: Alcoa's Appeal Is Somewhere Downstream
Story: By Stephen Cox, CMT     A Dow Jones Newswires Column     (This article was originally published Friday)     NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--Trading of the shares of U.S. aluminum maker Alcoa Inc. (AA) got rowdy Tuesday because of rumors the company and an Australian partner company might get a $40 billion takeover bid from BHP Billiton (BHP) or Rio Tinto PLC (RTP).   The rumor so far is unsubstantiated. Fundamental analysts doubted whether Billiton or Rio Tinto could be seriously interested in Alcoa' downstream aluminum processing business.   Charts suggest that Alcoa's appeal might also be compromised by the fact that its shares arguably haven't been trending since an over-25-year uptrend peaked in April 2001. Shares have been trading in a wide range between $45.71 and $17.62, which is the low of October 2002. Evidently, wide price swings can be profitable, but they don't have that buy-it-and-forget-it kind of comfort.   Even so, the short-term market suggests that the next move is liable to be higher, and at least the jobbers can get in on the fun.   Indeed, the takeover rumor caused shares to open nearly $2 higher on Tuesday at $34.85 and shares haven't given any ground since - that's bullish for the short term, anyway.  Shares as of this writing are trading roughly in the middle of a band of technical resistance between $33.75 and $35.18. Charts show that a breakout above that technical range would point the stock up to $41.24, although traders could expect a pullback of some description when resistance at the May 2006 high of $36.96 was tested.   But if $33.75 support is taken out then the stock would have been set up for an initial dip to $32.92, which is now the nearest stop-loss point for trades based on the monthly chart. A move below $32.92 might not stop before $30.15 support was tested.     (Stephen Cox, a chartered market technician, is chief technician for Dow Jones Newswires.)   -By Stephen Cox, Dow Jones Newswires; 201-938-2064; stephen.cox@dowjones.com   Data by CSI, Commodity Research Bureau, TradeStation Securities     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 07:30 ET (12:30 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Preformed Line Products 4Q Net More Than Doubles On Higher Sales
Story: DOW JONES NEWSWIRES   Preformed Line Products Co.'s (PLPC) fourth-quarter earnings more than doubled to $2 million on higher sales.   For the quarter ended Dec. 31, the Cleveland-based company earned $2.0 million or 38 cents a share, up from $883,000 or 15 cents a year earlier.   Sales for the quarter rose to $51.8 million from $46.7 million.   The company said its international operations had a record year for both sales and income and domestic sales, though lower on the year as a whole, recovered in the fourth quarter and were 9% stronger than a year earlier in its core energy and telecommunications markets.   Preformed Line Products designs and makes products and systems used in the construction and maintenance of overhead and underground networks for energy, communications and broadband network companies.   -Judy McKinnon; 416-306-2100; AskNewswires@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 07:57 ET (12:57 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Prosecutors Call For 6-Mo Sentence For Swissair's Last CEO
Story: BUELACH, Switzerland (AP)--Prosecutors proposed a six-month prison sentence for Mario Corti, the last chief executive of the now defunct Swissair, and a range of suspended sentences for 18 other airline executives, board members and consultants.   The defendants in Switzerland's largest corporate trial face have all pleaded innocent to charges that include damaging creditors, mismanagement, making false business statements and forging documents. Some have blamed the big Swiss banks and the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks for the airline's downfall.   Creditors and others damaged by the airline's collapse will present their case first, followed by the defense. Public hearings conclude on March 9, when the three-judge panel will start discussing the case behind close doors. It was unclear when a verdict could be announced.   Swissair was grounded abruptly on Oct. 2, 2001, after months of financial problems led to its being unable to pay for fuel and landing fees. Tens of thousands of passengers were stranded worldwide. Thousands of employees and shareholders lost their life savings, and the country's four main political parties demanded that former executives be held responsible.   The prosecution on Monday said that Corti, who was the last chief executive of parent SAirGroup, and the group's former head of finance Jacqualyn Fouse had failed to take action following the company's insolvency, and therefore caused "immense damage."   They were too late in filing for protection from creditors - a step short of bankruptcy under Swiss law - which led to a loss in liquidity of CHF177 million, the prosecution said.   Corti had released false information to the public covering up the extent of the financial problems, state prosecutor Ralph Ringger said.   Prosecuting Attorney Christian Weber said that, as the main person responsible for the collapse, Corti should be sentenced to 28 months in prison, but that 22 months of that sentence should be suspended, which means it would be ignored on condition of good behavior.   Weber also demanded a penalty of CHF1.08 million for Corti, which also would go unpaid after three years of good behavior, but that Corti be fined CHF10,000.   For all of the other defendants, prosecutors requested suspended sentences ranging up to 18 months, penalties up to CHF720,000 francs and fines up to CHF20,000 francs.     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 15:25 ET (20:25 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: UPDATE: Amec Sells JV Rail Unit In Restructuring Move
Story: By Anita Likus   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Construction and engineering company Amec PLC (AMEC.LN) Monday said it was selling its joint venture rail business to France's Colas S.A. (12163.FR), as part of its plan to restructure by selling off non-core businesses.   Amec said it has reached an unconditional agreement to sell its 50% interest in Amec SPIE Rail Systems Ltd and that the deal is expected to complete Apr. 2.   The company did not give financial details of the deal but one analyst pointed out that a company making GBP156 million in revenues "cannot generate a significant amount."   London-based Amec SPIE Rail Systems employs around 500 people with net assets of GBP26.7 million as of Dec. 31, 2005.   Newly-appointed Amec Chief Executive Samir Brikho said "the disposal of our interest to Colas is consistent with my objectives of finding strong purchasers with good prospects for all the Built Environment businesses."   One analyst said the disposal "is very significant for the company" as it is "the first step in its disposal strategy.   "The move will be welcomed by the market," he said.   Amec's shares opened slightly higher on the news. At 0817 GMT, they were up 3.75 pence or 0.8% at 484.75 pence in a broadly higher London market.   Amec designs, delivers and supports infrastructure assets across the public and private sectors. It employs 20,000 people and operates out of the U.K., U.S., and Canada with regional offices in Europe and Asia-Pacific.   CEO Brikho, who joined the company on Oct. 1, oversaw a review of the group's businesses and decided to dispose of all non-core activities, including the Built Environment businesses together with some specialist activities.   In December, Amec said it was splitting itself up -  selling building, civil engineering, facilities services, and property developments businesses and its public-private partnership portfolio.   It will retain its energy and metals services businesses, which had 2005 revenues of GBP1.8 billion and profit of GBP83 million.   Based on Friday's closing share price, Amec is valued at GBP1.62 billion. It will report full-year results for 2006 on March 14 when it will also update the market on the overall disposal process.     Company Web site: http://www.amec.com     -By Anita Likus, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-20-7842-9463; anita.likus@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 03:20 ET (08:20 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Continued Drill Results From The Flying Diamond Deposit Lisbon Valley, Utah>CCU.T
Story: DENVER, CO, Feb. 19 /CNW Telbec/ - Constellation Copper Corporation (CCU:TSX) is pleased to announce the results for ten additional core drill holes completed during 2006 at its Flying Diamond copper deposit and update information contained in a press release dated August 22, 2006. The Flying Diamond deposit is located about four miles southeast of the Company's Lisbon Valley copper mine and process plant. This release contains information on ten new drill holes which are located to the northwest and to the southeast of the original discovery area. Drilling continues in the Flying Diamond area with both a core drill and a rotary drill, and additional assay results will be released as they become available.    A drill hole location map of the Flying Diamond and Stateline deposits has been posted on the Company's website. The Stateline deposit is located to the southeast of, and is contiguous with, the Flying Diamond deposit.    The map shows all holes drilled (rotary, reverse circulation and core) in the deposit area including the holes discussed in this release, the holes discussed in previous releases and holes for which assay data is not yet available. During 2006 a total of 24 core holes, 8 reverse circulation holes and 32 rotary holes were completed in the Flying Diamond/Stateline area. An additional 5 core holes and 4 rotary holes have been completed so far in 2007.    Assay results are only presented by the Company for core holes drilled in the Flying Diamond and Stateline deposit areas. Assay results from conventional rotary and reverse circulation drill holes drilled in this area are not considered by the Company to be reliable for resource estimation purposes due to sample contamination resulting from high inflows of groundwater into the drill holes while drilling. Assay results from rotary holes are believed to be indicative of copper mineralization, however, and many of these holes have later been twinned with core holes.    Currently the Flying Diamond/Stateline deposit appears to be closed off to the northeast where it is terminated against the east splay of the Lisbon Valley Fault. Based on the results of the 10 drill holes, as well as the visual results from rotary holes and core holes not yet assayed, the Flying Diamond/Stateline deposit appears to be about 10,000 feet long in a northwest-southeast orientation parallel to the east splay of the Lisbon Valley Fault. Mineralization appears to persist away from the fault at least 600 feet to the southwest in much of the deposit. Copper mineralization is generally found within two flat-lying sandstone layers of Cretaceous age, an upper layer in the Dakota Formation and a lower layer in the Burro Canyon Formation, the same rock types and formations that host mineralization at the Centennial and Sentinel pits that are currently being mined farther to the northwest. The bulk of the copper mineralization is present as the leachable sulphide chalcocite.          <<      Drill Hole     From(ft)  To(ft)  Thickness(ft)  Cu% Total     Formation        06C-FLD-11       525      585          60          0.25     Burro Canyon        06C-FLD-12       475      490          15          0.46     Burro Canyon                       520      540          20          0.28     Burro Canyon        06C-FLD-13       461      550          89          0.56     Burro Canyon        06C-FLD-14       515      570          55          0.26     Burro Canyon        06C-FLD-15       430      452          22          0.41     Burro Canyon                       470      475           5          0.56     Burro Canyon        06C-FLD-16       530      555          25          0.66     Burro Canyon                       565      590          25          0.41     Burro Canyon                       610      615           5          0.66     Burro Canyon        06C-FLD-17       475      530          55          0.43     Burro Canyon        06C-FLD-18       235      240           5          0.16     Dakota                       475      525          50          0.26     Burro Canyon        06C-FLD-19       462      535          73          0.32     Burro Canyon        06C-FLD-20       515      580          65          0.36     Burro Canyon                       600      635          35          0.33     Burro Canyon      >>      The average intercept for the ten holes listed above is 61 feet grading 0.38% copper. All of the above holes are vertical and hence the thicknesses noted are considered to be true. Core hole 06C-FLD-21 was drilled into the Lisbon Valley Fault and only intersected a thin zone of mineralization in the Dakota Formation, while hole 06C-FLD-23 was abandoned due to drilling problems. Assays for core holes O6C-FLD-22 and -24 are pending. Core from holes 07C-STL-01, -02 and -03 is being logged and sawn prior to being shipped for assay. The core drill is currently active on hole 07C-STL-04 while the rotary drill is active on hole 07R-STL-03.    Results confirm the good overall continuity of grade and thickness of the Flying Diamond/Stateline deposit, particularly for the Burro Canyon-hosted mineralization. Copper mineralization at the Flying Diamond deposit is known to become closer to the surface going to the southeast, parallel to the east splay of the Lisbon Valley Fault, where it merges with the Stateline deposit. Drilling with both the core and the rotary rigs is currently focused on defining the mineralization in this southeast area where based on visual observations of core the depth to mineralization is in the range of 250 to 350 feet, rather than an average of approximately 500 feet in the majority of the Flying Diamond deposit defined to date.    Additional claims have been leased along the west side of lower Lisbon Valley, about two miles to the west of Flying Diamond, covering areas where outcropping copper mineralization exists. We plan on drilling these areas later in 2007 once permits have been obtained. We have also recently completed approximately ten line miles of shallow seismic survey lines in the lower Lisbon Valley area in an effort to better define the depth to favourable formations and the location of faults in this area which is largely covered by soil. The interpretation of the survey lines will be completed in the next few months and it is anticipated that a number of quality drilling targets will be identified.    All of the sample preparation and assays in this report have been performed by Skyline Labs, Tucson, Arizona. An assay QA/QC program is routinely followed and calls for the regular insertion of independent standards, blanks and duplicate samples. The results of the QA/QC program have been satisfactory. The drilling and assaying program are being performed under the supervision of Gary Parkison, Vice President Exploration & Development for Constellation Copper Corporation, a Certified Professional Geologist and a Qualified Person under National Instrument 43-101, who also prepared this release. Headline: 3rd UPDATE: Converium Rejects EUR1.85B Offer From Scor
Story: (This updates an item that ran at 0942 GMT, adding further detail, analyst and asset manager comment and an updated share price.)       By Goran Mijuk and Digby Larner     Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     ZURICH (Dow Jones)--Converium Holding AG (CHR) Monday rejected an estimated CHF3 billion (EUR1.85 billion) unsolicited offer from French rival Scor SA (SCO) that aims to create one of the world's top five multiline reinsurers.   Scor said separately that it had already built a 33% stake in Converium and that it was disappointed the board had rejected its offer, a stance that analysts said could prompt a bidding war for the midsize Swiss reinsurer.   The French company, which will have to make an official bid under Swiss law if its holding breaches the level of 33.3%, paid 20% in cash for the stake and the rest in new shares for a value of CHF21.1 a share for an estimated CHF880 million, or EUR542 million.   The takeover fight comes amid growing merger-and-acquisition activity in the insurance sector, as companies seek to tap external sources of business because of slowing growth in markets such as Europe and the U.S.   Companies in the reinsurance sector are seeing size, along with capital strength, as a key asset. Reinsurers provides coverage to insurers and in the past struggled with large losses from catastrophes such as heavy storms in the U.S.   Scor's move follows the 2006 takeover by Swiss Reinsurance Co. (RUKN.VX) of General Electric Co.'s (GE) reinsurance operations, a deal that was aimed at boosting both firms' capital strength and global reach.   Scor said a tie-up with Converium was "a unique strategic opportunity to create a top five global multiline reinsurer in this time of market consolidation."   A takeover of Converium by Scor would create a company with substantial life and non-life business with annual premiums of about EUR5.3 billion.   It would catapult the emerged company close to the world's largest reinsurers - led by Swiss Re; Munich Re (MUV2.XE); Berkshire Hathaway Re, a unit of Berkshire Hathaway Inc. (BRKB); and Germany's Hannover Re (HNR1.XE).   Analysts said the timing of the bid was sensible as Converium shares are still relatively cheap due to the company's restructuring.   But some, like Oddo Securities analyst Nicolas Jacob, cautioned that investors are concerned that Scor would have to make another call on capital markets to finance a merger and that the move indicates a troubling strategic shift toward the risky non-life reinsurance sector, where Converium is focused.   Scor came close to financial collapse in 2002 after losses from contracts written in the 1990s plunged it deep into the red. It was saved by a series of capital hikes worth more than EUR1 billion and a massive restructuring plan.   Its focus shifted toward life reinsurance, which has a steadier claims record than the more volatile property-and-casualty reinsurance sector that is often prone to huge claims from catastrophes such as hurricanes or earthquakes.   In July 2006, Scor agreed to acquire German life reinsurer Revios Rueckversicherung AG from Globale Rueckversicherungs AG for EUR605 million, a move that is expected to help Scor to pursue a path of profitable growth.   At 1300 GMT, Scor shares were down EUR1.68, or 8%, at EUR19.43. Converium was up CHF2.10, or 11%, at EUR20.90.   "The directors are unanimous in their rejection of this proposal," Converium said. "The proposal fundamentally fails to recognize the value of Converium's franchise and growth prospects, and is, therefore, not in the interest of Converium, its shareholders and its customers."   Under Scor's offer, the French company, which is roughly double the size of Converium, would be prepared to pay CHF21 per Converium share, constituting a 12.3% premium to Converium's closing price Friday of CHF18.7.   "A takeover of Converium by Scor would make sense, as it would give Scor's underwriting ability another boost," said Stefan Schuermann, analyst at Cheuvreux, who rates Converium at outperform.   Converium is still smarting from a heavy restructuring in the wake of a massive reserve shortfall in the U.S. in 2004, which required the company to issue new shares, reduce its staff and exit the U.S. reinsurance market.   Although the company has turned profitable since then and today boasts a strong capital base, Converium is still rated triple-B by most rating agencies, a level that is deemed too low for a reinsurer to do bulk business.   However, Converium expects an upgrade to the crucial A-level later this year once an industrywide probe by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is expected to be finalized.   Such a step wouldn't only boost its share price but also likely help spur premium growth and profitability, analysts said.   Converium itself expects its return on equity to reach 14% by 2009, up from 4.1% at the end of 2005, bringing it more in line with leading industry peers.   Given the company's prospects and Converium's close partnership with JP Morgan Chase & Co. (JPM) and Credit Suisse (CS), which advised the reinsurer to reject the deal, analyst expect the road to a successful takeover to be bumpy.   "The board's negative stance could trigger a bidding war, or probably a higher bid from Scor," said Rene Locher, analyst at Bank Sal. Oppenheim, who suggested that a Bermuda-base player with a strong capital base could enter the ring and grab Converium away from Scor.   While Swiss privately held investment company Patinex AG, which is led by Swiss financier Martin Ebner, said it has sold its near-20% stake in the company, Converium has a relatively widespread shareholder base, which won't be easy to persuade to sell at the current price, analysts said.   Around 51% of Converium's shareholders are in Switzerland, often pension funds, followed by 24% in the U.K. and 21% in the U.S.   Among the larger shareholders are Zuercher Kantonalbank with a roughly 7% stake and San Francisco-based investment company Dodge & Cox with a 5% stake. Zuercher Kantonalbank declined to comment, while Dodge & Cox couldn't be immediately reached.   "We are currently observing what is going on and have no intention to sell right now," said Peter Gachnang, portfolio manager at Swisscanto, one of Switzerland's largest asset managers with around CHF60 billion in funds. "There is a chance that the offer will be increased or that a white knight could appear." He didn't specify the size of the fund's Converium stake.   Company Web site: http://www.converium.com     -By Goran Mijuk and Digby Larner, Dow Jones Newswires; +41 43 443 80 47; goran.mijuk@dowjones.com   (Digby Larner reported this item from Paris.)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 08:21 ET (13:21 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Anvil to Proceed with Detailed Evaluation of Itogon Mineral Properties in the Philippines
Story: TSX, ASX: AVM      Common shares outstanding 56.7 million      All amounts are expressed in US dollars, unless otherwise stated.      MONTREAL, Feb. 19 /CNW/ - Anvil Mining Limited (TSX, ASX: AVM), ("Anvil" or "the Company") is pleased to announce that following completion of due diligence in December 2006, it has elected to proceed with a detailed evaluation of the Itogon Suyoc Resources Inc. ("Itogon") mineral properties in the Philippines. The Company made a cash payment of $2.0 million to Itogon on February 16, 2007 and will provide funding to a minimum of $2.0 million in exploration expenditures and use its best efforts to complete the detailed evaluation within a two-year period.      In August 2006, the Company signed an Evaluation and Development Agreement with Itogon, a private Philippines minerals company, for their gold properties in the Baguio District on Luzon Island in the Philippines. The Itogon properties cover an area of 2,896 hectares and are located 12 km to the southeast of Baguio City and approximately 200 km north of Manila, the capital of the Philippines. A map of the properties can be accessed at http://www.anvil.com.au/itogon.shtml. The properties also include the Itogon underground gold mine which, up until it was put on care and maintenance in 1996, produced approximately one million ounces of gold and 400,000 ounces of silver from ore with an average gold grade of 6.9 g/t.      The Baguio District has been the most significant gold producing district in the Philippines with historical production of 28 million ounces of gold and 2.3 million tonnes of copper. It is located within a dilation zone at a change of direction of the Philippine Fault Zone, a major geological feature which transgresses the Philippine archipelago for a distance of more than 1,200 km. A great number of the epithermal gold and porphyry copper deposits in the Philippines appear to be spatially related to this major fault zone. The Philex Mine located 10 km to the southwest of the Itogon properties has historical production of 5 million ounces of gold, 5 million ounces of silver and almost 2 million tonnes of copper.      The agreement provides for the Company to acquire 100% of the Itogon mineral properties by completing a staged evaluation process, which, in addition to the cash payment of $2.0 million to Itogon, and funding to a minimum of $2.0 million in exploration expenditures includes the following terms and conditions:             <<       -   Subsequent to the detailed evaluation, completion of a feasibility           study on a 'best efforts' basis within a period of two years;          -   A cash payment of $500,000 upon transfer of Itogon's rights to the           mineral properties to the Company;          -   Payment of a Net Smelter Return (NSR) Royalty to Itogon on all           mineral production derived from the Itogon mineral properties by the           Company. For silver and copper production, the NSR Royalty will be           calculated at a rate of 2.5% and 3% respectively, while for gold, it           will be calculated according to a sliding scale, at a rate from 1.5%           to 5%, directly dependent upon the selling price of gold; and          -   A one-off production bonus payment to Itogon of $1.25 million, once           200,000 ounces of gold has been recovered from the Itogon mineral           properties by Anvil.       >>         Following the cash payment of $2 million in February 2007, the Company will now progress with the detailed evaluation of the properties which will include geological mapping and sampling and other evaluation work leading to a drilling program expected to commence in early 2008.      Anvil Mining Limited is an unhedged copper and silver producer whose shares are listed for trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange (as common shares) and the Australian Stock Exchange (as CDIs) under the symbol AVM. It owns and operates the Dikulushi copper-silver mine and the Kulu copper tailings operation in the Katanga Province of the DRC. In addition, the Company is currently developing the Kinsevere project as the Company's third mine in the DRC.      Caution Regarding Forward Looking Statements: The forward-looking statements made in this news release are based on assumptions and judgments of management regarding future events and results. Such forward-looking statements, including but not limited to those with respect to the exploration and evaluation work to be conducted on the Itogon properties in the Philippines, known and unknown risks, uncertainties, and other factors which may cause the actual results, performance or achievements of the Company to be materially different from any anticipated future results, performance or achievements expressed or implied by such forward-looking statements. Such factors include, among others, the actual market prices of gold, silver and copper, the actual results of future exploration, the actual results of future development activities, changes in project parameters as plans continue to be evaluated, as well as those factors disclosed in the Company's filed documents.      %SEDAR: 00020549E           /CONTACT: Craig Munro, Vice President Corporate & Finance and CFO, Tel: +61 (8) 9481 4700, Email: craigm@anvilmining.com (Perth); Robert La Vallière, Vice President Investor Relations, Tel: (Office) (514) 448-6664, (Cell) (514) 944-9036, Email: robertl@anvilmining.com (Montréal); Website: www.anvilmining.com          (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 03:12 ET (08:12 GMT)

Headline: UPDATE: Enterprise Shrs Soar 13% On Bid Talks With 3i>ETR.LN
Story: By Anita Likus   Of DOW JONES NEWSWIRES     LONDON (Dow Jones)--Enterprise PLC (ETR.LN) shares soared Monday after the cleaning and maintenance group said it's in talks with private equity house 3i Group PLC (III.LN) regarding a GBP486 million potential takeover.   A committee of independent non-executive directors of Enterprise - comprising Nick Woollacott and Alistair Hetherington - said it is in discussions with 3i Investments regarding an offer at 605 pence-per-share.   The offer price would include any final dividend.   One analyst said he sees 605 pence-per-share as a decent premium to the share price last spring when takeover talk was first heard.   Enterprise's shares rose almost 13% on the news, but remained about 4% below the mooted offer price. At 1330 GMT the shares were trading up 52 pence at 583 pence in a and at 1216 GMT Enterprise's shares were up 52 pence or 10% at 583 in a slightly higher London market.   Enterprise provides maintenance and support for major infrastructure networks for U.K. companies. Its chosen markets are utilities, central and local government.   Enterprise has been approached in November by a private equity firm and confirmed in January that is it has rejected an approach of 575 pence-per-share as it undervalued the company.   The company had a strong first-half ending June 30, posting a 13% increase in underlying cash-flow from operating activities rose to GBP13.4 million - despite restructuring and one-off costs.   One analyst noted that specialist nature of the business of Enterprise could also attract interest from other private equity buyers.   He added nonetheless that if another private equity house was interested they would have made their move already.   Close Brothers Corporate Finance Ltd. and Gleacher Shacklock LLP are acting as financial adviser for Enterprise.   Company Web site: http://www.enterprise.plc.uk   -By Anita Likus, Dow Jones Newswires; 44-20-7842-9463; anita.likus@dowjones.com   (Katie Hope contributed to this article)     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 08:43 ET (13:43 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : AXcess News: Envrio-Ag Company Benefits from Higher Silver Prices
Story: HOUSTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--February 19, 2007--   Higher gold and silver prices this month may have gotten a boost from higher oil, but a little-known enviro-ag company in Reno, Nevada is apt to benefit from it considering it's the only maker of a pure 5-ounce silver bar in the U.S.     Itronics, Inc. (OTCBB: ITRO) operates the only plant in North America approved by the Environmental Protection Agency to recycle photochemicals, removing the heavy metals and turning the liquids into an environmentally friendly liquid fertilizer it markets under the GOLD'n GRO label. But it also removes the silver and from it manufactures a 5-ounce pure silver bar of numismatic quality which every year are numbered, pushing the silver bars' value up as collectors snap them up.     Itronics announced on January 23 that it was making its 2007 limited edition Silver Nevada Miner bars available to the public. It marks the seventh year in a row that the Company has offered a limited edition 5-ounce silver bar to the public and with it, growing demand.     Itronics founder Dr. John Whitney credited the public's rising interest in silver for the substantial increase in sales. "In 2006 the price of silver was up 58 percent, generating significant consumer interest in this precious metal," said Dr. Whitney.     While sales rose substantially Itronics has had to go outside to buy silver in larger quantities in order to keep up with demand. That has meant buying the commodity on spot prices, which in the last month have been rising. That increase could support better margins for Itronics silver sales in the upcoming period.     Just days before the 2007 series Silver Nevada Miner bars were announced, Itronics reported that fourth quarter sales of silver bars rose 235 percent over the same period last year while fertilizer sales climbed 47 percent. But with silver prices closing in the $14 per ounce range on Friday, its existing inventory should add to the company's first quarter results. In a telephone interview, Whitney said that though silver prices were higher the increase would not be that substantial to Itronics' overall results, pointing out that GOLD'n GRO revenue was far outpacing silver bars. Dr. Whitney declined to give an early forecast ahead of the company's filings.     Monday, spot silver traded $14.02 to $14.07 an ounce in London, up from Friday's $13.95 to $14.00 price range. Commodity markets in the U.S. were closed Monday due to President's Day, so contract demand was also up on that exchange.     Note to Editors: "News Features" are stories provided to publishers copyright-free for print or online display at no charge. All we ask is that publishers include our byline (AXcess News) as the source, and a link to our Web site: http://www.axcessnews.com. If you are interested in displaying our news on a regular basis, please contact our editorial department at: 775-841-5368. Headline: CP Rail Declares Force Majeure At Vancouver's North Shore
Story: WINNIPEG (Dow Jones)--Disruptions from the ongoing strike at Canadian National Railway Co. (CNI) have caused the country's other major rail line, Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd. (CP), to declare force majeure on shipments to and from some terminals at Vancouver's North Shore, a CP Rail official confirmed Monday.   A memo was sent out last week declaring force majeure to any affected customers moving products to and from the North Shore of the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, CP Rail spokesman Ed Greenberg said.   "Overall, operations are functioning effectively," Greenberg said. "However, we are experiencing a slowdown in traffic destined to CN-served locations on the North Shore."   Through a co-production agreement between the two railways, CN handles train switching operations on the North Shore. With management personnel handling the work of CN's striking conductors and yard workers, the interchange traffic on the North Shore isn't running very smoothly, according to Greenberg.   Greenberg couldn't talk about any particular shipments that were being affected by the force majeure. However, industry sources said grains and potash were both involved. Of Canada's major grain handlers, James Richardson International and the Saskatchewan Wheat Pool (SWP.T) both have terminals on the North Shore of Burrard Inlet.   Greenberg said CP Rail wasn't actively seeking to pick up any incremental business as a result of the CN labor disruption. "Our priority remains on CP customers," he said.   About 2,800 CN Rail employees have been on strike since Feb. 10. CN Rail maintains that the strike by the United Transportation Union is illegal, as the union's international leadership hasn't given its approval. The three sides are set to meet Monday before the Canadian Industrial Relations Board.     -By Phil Franz-Warkentin, Dow Jones Newswires; 204-947-1700; resnews@compuserve.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 11:49 ET (16:49 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Xerox Expands Continuous-Feed Printing Line to 11 Digital Systems; Adds Innovative Product Design, New Technology to Portfolio
Story: ROCHESTER, N.Y.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--February 19, 2007--   Xerox Corporation (NYSE: XRX) has expanded its line of super-fast continuous-feed printers, today announcing the entry-level Xerox 495 Continuous Feed Duplex Printer. The new digital printer features a unique, small-footprint design and innovative fusing technology that results in better image quality and productivity than competitive systems.     With the addition of the 500 image-per-minute Xerox 495, the Xerox continuous-feed line now includes 11 different products that range in speed from 250 simplex to 1064 duplex ipm, giving commercial print shops, in-plant print operations and service bureaus even more flexibility to produce high-volume print jobs.     "Xerox is targeting the continuous-feed market with the same intensity as the cut-sheet side of the business," said Quincy Allen, president, Xerox Production Systems Group. "The Xerox 495 is a great example of our increasing investment in innovative continuous-feed technology to complement our production printing portfolio. And there is more to come."     The Xerox 495 system offers users the opportunity to produce new revenue-generating applications. Print providers can use the printer to expand beyond transactional jobs, such as invoices or statements, and efficiently tackle publishing applications like owners' manuals, catalogs and on-demand books that are typically reserved for cut-sheet printers.     The Xerox 495 offers a unique configuration for "wide-web duplex printing." It is the only system currently on the market that simultaneously prints both sides of an 18" wide web with a single, compact print engine. This design occupies about half the space of competitive twin-duplex configurations, saving significant space in a print operation. Printing duplex on a wide web is key to maximizing productivity for print-on-demand applications or two-up documents -- two individual statements or invoices on one sheet of paper.     "The Xerox 495 is an affordable continuous-feed solution with a compact and flexible design that will bring a new dimension of productivity into transaction environments, particularly those where space is at a premium," said Jim Hamilton, director, InfoTrends On Demand Printing & Publishing Consulting Service.     A key competitive advantage of the Xerox 495 printer is its "non-contact flash fusing" technology. It creates an image using high-intensity flash lamps and a uniquely designed toner instead of conventional heat and pressure rollers. Flash fusing only heats the toner; there is no direct heat or pressure roller contact with the paper, maintaining moisture in the paper and minimizing or eliminating stock shrinkage, paper curl and static electricity. The result is improved registration and increased productivity and reliability because the chances of paper jamming during the printing or finishing processes are reduced.     Furthermore, the reliability of flash fusing technology allows document designers to use a wide range of substrates to create innovative applications that require adhesives, such as plastic identification cards and peel-off labels on statements, price tags and stickers, and RFID transponder inlays.       Entry-level offering     The printer's speed, image quality and flexibility let users quickly switch between print-on-demand jobs, such as newsletters and brochures, and transactional jobs, driving page-volume growth and profits across both segments of their business. The product is particularly suited for print providers seeking a high-volume system with more productivity than a cut-sheet digital printer. It is also aimed at users transitioning a single-stock application, where only one type of media is being used for the job, from cut-sheet to continuous-feed.     RPM Print & Design in the United Kingdom selected the Xerox 495 system for its productivity and image quality.     "We had been looking at the continuous-feed market for some time but had been a little disappointed with the quality of the output, particularly the halftones," said Jonathan Harry, managing director, RPM Print & Design. "But what really impressed us about the Xerox 495 was the superior image quality and speed it delivers. This printer is a real step forward in terms of economics of operation and quality."       The Xerox 495 printer also:       --  Prints on pin-fed paper, either roll or box fed, at 115          feet-per-minute.       --  Runs 250 ipm in simplex mode, 500 ipm duplex, regardless of          the substrate being used. Many competitive machines have to          slow down for lightweight, heavier or specialty stocks.       --  Offers tight front-to-back registration and 600 dots-per-inch          resolution to enhance the graphics and photos accompanying          publishing and transactional printing applications.       --  Offers an easy auto-loading and auto-registration/alignment          system for quick or frequent stock changes for shorter run          lengths.       --  Operates simply and efficiently with a built-in Xerox print          controller and color touch-screen graphical user interface.       Availability and pricing     The Xerox 495 Continuous Feed Duplex Printer is immediately available in North America, Europe and developing markets through Xerox sales representatives at a list price of U.S. $425,000.       Customer Contacts:     For more information about Xerox production systems, software and services, visit www.xerox.com/products or call 800-ASK-XEROX.     NOTE TO EDITORS: For product photography and more information about Xerox, visit www.xerox.com/news. XEROX(R) is a trademark of XEROX CORPORATION. Prices, features, specifications, capabilities, appearance and availability of Xerox products and services are subject to change without notice. Headline: : OMX: MP Investment Bank Extends Its Membership of the Nordic Exchange
Story: STOCKHOLM, Sweden--(BUSINESS WIRE)--February 19, 2007--   MP Investment Bank hf. will become a member of the Stockholm Stock Exchange as of Wednesday, February 21. They will thereby gain trading access to the Swedish equity market.     MP Investment Bank is already a member of the Nordic Exchange in Iceland, Tallinn, Riga and Vilnius. The membership is expected to be expanded further to include trading in Helsinki and Copenhagen shortly. MP Investment Bank will thereby become a fully Nordic member.     "We are very happy to welcome MP Investment Bank as a member of OMX Nordic Exchange in Stockholm. The expanded membership gives MP Investment Bank an excellent opportunity to offer their customers easy and direct access to trading on the Nordic Exchange", says Jukka Ruuska, President OMX Nordic Exchange (STO:OMX).     MP Investment Bank is a privately held investment bank operating from its headquarters in Iceland. The bank provides asset management and brokerage services and has a Corporate Finance department. MP Investment Bank was founded in 1999 and became an investment bank in 2003.       The Nordic Exchange has 159 members in 13 different countries.       About OMX     OMX is a leading expert in the exchange industry. Through the Nordic Exchange, OMX offers access to approximately 80 percent of the Nordic and Baltic securities market. The Nordic Exchange is a term used for marketing purposes and is not a legal entity. It describes the common offering from the Helsinki Stock Exchange, Copenhagen Stock Exchange, Stockholm Stock Exchange, Iceland Stock Exchange, Tallinn Stock Exchange, Riga Stock Exchange and Vilnius Stock Exchange. OMX integrated technology solutions cross the transaction chain enabling efficient securities transactions for over 60 exchange organizations in more than 50 countries. OMX is a Nordic Large Cap company in the Financial sector on the OMX Nordic Exchange. For more information, please visit www.omxgroup.com.     This information was brought to you by Waymaker http://www.waymaker.net        CONTACT: OMX Nordic Exchange               Anders Rubensson, + 46 8 405 63 03        SOURCE: OMX  Copyright Business Wire 2007     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 08:13 ET (13:13 GMT)

Headline: : Kimberly-Clark to Webcast Presentations and Q&A at Consumer Analyst Group of New York Conference on February 23, 2007
Story: DALLAS, Feb. 19 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Kimberly-Clark Corporation (NYSE: KMB) will webcast its participation in the 2007 Consumer Analyst Group of New York (CAGNY) conference from 10:30 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. CST on Friday, Feb. 23.  Tom Falk, Chairman and CEO, and Robert Abernathy, Group President, Developing and Emerging Markets, will make presentations about the company's strategies for growing its global health and hygiene business and will subsequently answer questions from conference attendees.     A link to the broadcast and related presentation slides will be provided through the Investors section of Kimberly-Clark's Web site at http://www.kimberly-clark.com . The webcast will be available for replay for approximately three weeks through the link provided on the Web site.     Kimberly-Clark and its well-known global brands are an indispensable part of life for people in more than 150 countries. Every day, 1.3 billion people-- nearly a quarter of the world's population--trust K-C brands and the solutions they provide to enhance their health, hygiene and well being. With brands such as Kleenex, Scott, Huggies, Pull-Ups, Kotex and Depend, Kimberly-Clark holds the No. 1 or No. 2 share position in more than 80 countries. To keep up with the latest K-C news and to learn more about the company's 135-year history of innovation, visit http://www.kimberly-clark.com .    SOURCE  Kimberly-Clark Corporation       /CONTACT: Media, Dave Dickson, +1-972-281-1481, or ddickson@kcc.com , or investors, Mike Masseth, +1-972-281-1478, or mmasseth@kcc.com , both of Kimberly-Clark Corporation      /Web site: http://www.kimberly-clark.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 16:58 ET (21:58 GMT)

Headline: : Option's New Wireless Module Embedded by Sharp
Story: LEUVEN, Belgium, February 19 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ --     - GTM478 Module Incorporated in eMobile's Next Generation Broadband Terminal "EM-ONE"     Option (Euronext: OPTI; OPNVY), the leading wireless technology company, today announced that it is supplying eMobile Japan with both the new GTM478 embedded wireless module and the GlobeTrotter EXPRESS 7.2. Both products uniquely operate the 1.7 GHz frequency band. The wireless module is incorporated in the "EM-ONE", the next-generation mobile broadband device, designed to deliver a high-speed, always-on broadband environment as an alternative to a personal computer. The "EM-ONE" is manufactured by Sharp, Japan's leading vendor in mobile device development. The products were unveiled today by eMobile's Chairman and CEO Sachio Semmoto at the press conference in Tokyo announcing the launch of the HSDPA Mobile Data Service "EM Mobile Broadband" from March 31 2007. Also presenting at eMobile's press conference were Sharp, Qualcomm and Microsoft.     "EM-ONE" supports eMobile's HSDPA communications service with a maximum downlink speed of 3.6Mbps. "EM-ONE" adopts Japan's first W-VGA (800 X 480 dot) under Windows Mobile 5.0 environment, and is also equipped with the industry's first 4.1 inch high definition liquid crystal large screen. Such a screen enables the user to view PC websites without horizontal scrolling. Furthermore, "EM-ONE" is equipped with the same keyboard layout as a PCs yet at just 18.9 mm thick, the device is one of the thinnest mobile terminals with a QWERTY keyboard in Japan.     "I am honoured that eMobile has selected Option as its partner for both for our new compact wireless module embedded in the "EM-ONE" and our GlobeTrotter EXPRESS 7.2 data card. eMobile is a pioneer of wireless broadband multimedia services and devices that go beyond the mobile phone and has an exciting vision for the future," said Jan Callewaert, CEO of Option. "Our partnership with eMobile and Sharp recognises Option's world class wireless technology expertise and relentless customer focus."     The new GTM478 is a compact module with a board-to-board connector making it the ideal module for embedding into small mobile devices such as PDA's and mobile multimedia devices. It incorporates HSDPA, UMTS and EDGE, GPRS and GSM. It is designed to achieve peak HSDPA download speeds of 7.2 Mbps while backward compatibility ensures HSDPA connections can also be made at lower data rates of 3.6 Mbps and 1.8 Mbps with upload speeds to 384 Kbps. The GTM478 also supports both A-GPS and S-GPS.     The GlobeTrotter EXPRESS 7.2 Express Card, based on he PCI-standard, delivers true wireless broadband performance, while dual-antennae Advanced Receiver Technology sustains faster and more stable connections over wider coverage areas. For launches before availability of HSDPA 7.2 Mbps networks, the product can be provided with HSDPA 3.6Mbps and boosted to 7.2 Mbps via a simple firmware upgrade. In all cases backward compatibility ensures HSDPA connections at lower data rates of 3.6 Mbps and 1.8 Mbps. In spite of its advanced performance, the GlobeTrotter EXPRESS 7.2 is a truly "plug and play" device. When the EXPRESS 7.2 is inserted into the Express Card slot of a laptop, Option's patented Zero CD(R) technology automatically loads all necessary software and drivers from the data card itself: no software needs to be installed from a CD-ROM.     eMobile Ltd. is a subsidiary of eAccess Ltd. (Tokyo Stock Exchange: 9427), a champion of deregulation in the Japanese telecommunications sector and now one of the country's largest ADSL providers. Utilizing its broadband network and its ADSL and ISP business partnerships, eAccess established eMobile to enter the Japanese mobile carrier market. eMobile secured a 1.7GHz spectrum license in late 2005. eMobile will launch its services, combining the latest in mobile technologies with highly innovative business models, on March 31 2007. eMobile's principal shareholders are eAccess Ltd., The Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Tokyo Broadcasting System Inc. The company is headquartered in Tokyo - Japan.     Sharp Corporation is a worldwide developer of innovative products and core technologies that play a key role in shaping the future of electronics. As a leader in liquid crystal displays (LCDs) and digital technologies, Sharp offers one of the broadest and most advanced lines of consumer electronics, information products and electronic components, while also creating new network businesses.        About Option     Option, the wireless technology company, is a leading innovator in the design, development and manufacture of 3G WCDMA (HSPA and UMTS), EDGE, GPRS, GSM and WLAN technology products for wireless connectivity solutions. Option has built up an enviable reputation for creating exciting products that enhance the performance and functionality of wireless communications. Option's headquarters are in Leuven, Belgium. The company has Research & Development in Leuven, a Software and Applications development centre in Adelsried (Germany), a Wireless Router development centre in Stockholm (Sweden), an ISO 9002 production engineering and logistics facility in Cork, Ireland. Option also has sales & support operations in the US, Japan and Taiwan. For more information please visit www.option.com.    SOURCE  Option N V       /CONTACT: For more information please contact: Douglas Ros, Vice President Business Development, Tel +32-(0)16-317-411, E-mail: d.ros@option.com. Frederic Convent, CFO Option, Tel +32-(0)-16-317-471, E-mail: investor@option.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 06:33 ET (11:33 GMT)

Headline: Peru Releases 2006 Gold, Copper, Zinc, Silver Output Totals
Story: LIMA (Dow Jones)--Peru's output of gold totaled 15,426 kilograms in December, while for full-year 2006, gold production totaled 203,269 kilograms, the Ministry of Energy and Mines said Monday.   Zinc production was 101,347 tons in December, while for full-year 2006, zinc production was 1,201,794 tons.   Copper production was 96,548 metric tons in December. For full-year 2006, copper production totaled 1,048,897 tons, the ministry said.   Silver production in December was 323,293 kilograms, while for full-year 2006, silver production was 3,470,725 kilograms.   Among some of the other minerals, the government said that molybdenum output was 1,514 tons in December. In the full-year, molybdenum output totaled 17,209 tons.   Lead production was 29,546 tons in December. In the full year, lead output totaled 313,325 tons.   Tin output was 3,187 tons in December. For the full year, tin production totaled 38,470 tons.   Iron output totaled 339,058 tons in December. Iron output for the full year totaled 4,784,601 tons.   Mineral production has become a motor of the Andean nation's economic growth, with a number of new mines opening in recent years.     -By Robert Kozak, Dow Jones Newswires; 511-221-7050; peru@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 09:41 ET (14:41 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: Spanish Regulator Suspends Trade In Metrovacesa Shares -3-
Story: Metrovacesa, which acquired control of France's Gecina (1004086.FR) in 2005, is the euro-zone's largest real-estate company by assets.   One of the entities, to be called Metrovacesa, will group the company's Spanish real-estate assets as well as its French rental assets and will be have the Sanahuja family as its main shareholder.   The second entity, to be called Gecina, will include the company's French real-estate assets and some of its Spanish office rental business and will have Rivero, currently Metrovacesa's chairman, and the Solers as its main shareholders.   -By Jonathan House and Christopher Bjork, Dow Jones Newswires; +34 91 395 8120; jonathan.house@dowjones.com     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 03:07 ET (08:07 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: JPMorgan Formally Set For GBP7B Auction Of Chrysler - Report
Story: NEW YORK (Dow Jones)--U.S. investment bank JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) will formally kick off a GBP7 billion auction for DaimlerChrysler AG's (DCX) Chrysler unit by sending information memorandums to a number of potential suitors as early as this week, The Sunday Times reported on its Web Site Monday.   The bank will release data that includes private information on Chrysler, according to the report.   It is also understood that a number of interested bidders started basic due diligence on Chrysler weeks before DaimlerChrysler said that all options for its U.S. car firm were being considered, the Times reported.   General Motors Corp. (GM) is already in preliminary talks with DaimlerChrysler about an acquisition of all or part of Chrysler but is particularly interested in its Jeep and Dodge marques.   A DaimlerChrysler spokesman would only reiterate chairman Dieter Zetsche's comments last week that nothing was being excluded in an attempt to find "the best solution" for Chrysler, the paper reported.   Banking sources close to events said last night that talks between DamilerChrysler and potential bidders for Chrysler were at any early stage, The Sunday Times reported.   Newspaper Web site:www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 03:35 ET (08:35 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: SmartMoney(3/1) Street Smart: Betting Against The Greenback
Story: (From SMARTMONEY)     By Russell Pearlman   OUR TIMING was off when, in March 2005's "Falling Dollar, Rising Stocks," we predicted that the dollar's slide would be a boon to several U.S. companies, making their products cheaper to foreign buyers. Pretty much as soon as we went to press, the dollar rebounded, ultimately turning in a 10 percent gain against other major currencies in 2005. Our portfolio held up in spite of the bad call, returning 9 percent that year and beating the S&P 500 by two percentage points. Then, in 2006, the dollar returned to its downward trajectory, and we couldn't help but revisit the portfolio in 2007. The news was even better this time: The portfolio returned 38 percent, trouncing the S&P 500's 24 percent.   Sure, we were wrong (or as some investors call it, "early"), but at least we were in good company: Berkshire Hathaway lost more than $1 billion betting on the greenback's decline in 2005. And the dollar's resurgence didn't last long: In 2006, thanks in large part to the nation's massive trade deficit and low interest rates, it returned to the downward spiral begun in 2002. The decline indeed contributed to the spectacular overall return of our portfolio, though in the future, investors should evaluate these stocks on company-specific factors, not the direction of the dollar.   The top performer was Commercial Metals; the steelmaker's profit nearly tripled from 2004 to 2006 as steel prices skyrocketed. The weaker dollar, combined with higher worldwide demand, has sent the prices of all metals higher. Metal users worldwide switched to Commercial's product, which is made from recycled steel, instead of buying newly made, more expensive steel. But now that China has become a net exporter of steel, expect prices to fall, along with Commercial's pricing power. Its earnings -- and its stock -- don't have much room to grow.   Tractor maker Deere jumped 38 percent, but much of that growth came from investors betting that U.S. farmers would buy more equipment to plant more corn  for ethanol production. Deere sold only 2 percent more farm equipment abroad in 2006 than it did in 2005, so the weaker dollar didn't help much with sales. There are better investment ideas.   The weak dollar did help propel Colgate-Palmolive's stock 38 percent higher. Nearly a quarter of its $11 billion in sales comes from Brazil, Mexico and other Latin American nations, whose currencies gained the most ground versus the dollar. The greenback's more recent decline against the euro should benefit Colgate in 2007 since 28 percent of its sales comes from Europe.   And the world still loves Coca-Cola. More than 70 percent of its $24 billion in revenue comes from outside the U.S., and that helped Coke's stock rise 25 percent. However, Coke still has problems convincing more Americans and Japanese to drink The Real Thing, and those two nations make up nearly half of sales. At 20 times expected 2007 earnings, Coke isn't cheap, either. PepsiCo looks like a better buy.   3M's stock dropped over the past two years, but its dividend helped investors break even. The dollar's fall certainly helped sales, but any gains were canceled out by 3M's need to cut prices to unload excessive inventory, an issue that seems to have been resolved. The company bought back a record $1.2 billion worth of stock last summer at about the same price it commands now. Individual investors would do well to follow suit.   ---         THE DOLLAR IS FALLING, BUT RETURNS ARE NOT                                     Price    Price     Total  Company (Ticker)                  1/19/05   1/10/07   Return    3M (MMM)                           $82.17    $77.85     -0.9%  Coca-Cola (KO)                      41.10     48.68     25.0  Colgate-Palmolive (CL)              50.07     66.04     37.7  Commercial Metals (CMC)             27.14*    25.30     89.9  Deere (DE)                          70.05     92.63     37.5  Portfolio                             -         -       37.9  S&P 500                               -         -       24.0    *Split-adjusted. DATA: BLOOMBERG     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 06:01 ET (11:01 GMT)  Copyright (c) 2007 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.

Headline: : Boeing and LOT Polish Airlines Finalize Order for One Additional 787 Dreamliner
Story: SEATTLE, Feb. 19 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Boeing (NYSE: BA) and LOT Polish Airlines announced today that the airline has increased its 787 Dreamliner order by one additional aircraft, bringing its total 787 order to eight airplanes. In 2005, LOT placed an order for seven 787s, with delivery positions beginning in 2008.     Today's order, valued at $153 million at list prices, was booked previously on Boeing's Orders and Deliveries website, attributed to an unidentified customer.     "We are delighted with the steady progress we're witnessing on the 787 Program and are eager to see the first 787 this year," said Marek Mazur, chief executive officer of LOT Polish Airlines. "Furthermore, we are making excellent progress in preparing for the arrival of the first 787 in our fleet in 2008. We take great pride in being the first European carrier to operate the world's newest, most advanced airplane."     The 787 will revolutionize the customer experience for LOT's passengers. Passengers will enjoy an innovative new interior environment with higher humidity, wider seats and aisles, and larger windows, greatly improving the overall flying experience.     "This follow-on order is a wonderful confirmation of the outstanding value LOT places on the 787," said Marlin Dailey, vice president of Sales for Europe, Russia and Central Asia. "A dedicated team from Boeing and LOT, one of our early European customers on the program, is making great progress for the introduction of the 787 into their fleet."     The Boeing 787 Dreamliner, with first delivery scheduled for 2008, provides passengers with a better flying experience and operators with a more efficient commercial jetliner. Including today's order by LOT, 37 customers have logged 468 orders and commitments worth more than $73 billion at current list prices since the 787 launch in April 2004, making the Dreamliner the most successful commercial airplane launch in history.     Photo and caption are available with this release on http://boeingmedia.com .    SOURCE  Boeing Co.       /CONTACT: Samantha Solomon, London, + 44 7920 532 437, or Adam Morgan, Seattle, +1-425-294-6103, both of Boeing Co.      /Web site: http://www.boeing.com/     (END) Dow Jones Newswires  February 19, 2007 12:13 ET (17:13 GMT)

Headline: : Merit Medical Systems Announces Earnings Release Date/Time and Conference Call Information for the Year Ended December 31, 2006
Story: SOUTH JORDAN, Utah--(BUSINESS WIRE)--February 19, 2007--   Merit Medical Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:MMSI), a leading manufacturer and marketer of proprietary disposable devices used primarily in cardiology and radiology procedures, announced today that the Company will release its financial results for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2006, after the close of the stock market on Wednesday, February 28, 2007.     Merit will hold its investor conference call on the same day (Wednesday, February 28, 2007) at 5:00 p.m. Eastern (4:00 p.m. Central, 3:00 p.m. Mountain, and 2:00 p.m. Pacific). The telephone numbers to call are (domestic) 800-240-2430; and (international) 303-262-2137.     A live webcast will also be available for the conference at www.merit.com and www.fulldisclosure.com. To listen to the live broadcast, please enter the site 10-15 minutes prior to the call in order to download any necessary media players. Just click on the "CCBN Webcast" logo on the lower right-hand corner of Merit's home page. The webcast will be archived on both sites. There is no other replay access to the call.       ABOUT MERIT     Founded in 1987, Merit Medical Systems, Inc. is engaged in the development, manufacture and distribution of proprietary disposable medical accessories used in interventional and diagnostic procedures, particularly in cardiology and radiology. Merit serves client hospitals worldwide with a domestic and international sales force totaling approximately 85 individuals. Merit employs approximately 1,750 people worldwide, with facilities in Salt Lake City and South Jordan, Utah; Santa Clara, California; Angleton, Texas; Richmond, Virginia; Maastricht and Venlo, the Netherlands; and Galway, Ireland.        CONTACT: Merit Medical Systems, Inc.               Anne-Marie Wright, Vice President of Corporate               Communications, 801-208-4167               awright@merit.com        SOURCE: Merit Medical Systems, Inc.
